By the end of this theme, students will be able to:
• Talk about how some kids might need help playing and how to make play fair for everyone. • Show kindness by thinking about what others need to have fun and feel included.
• Explore how shapes, colors, and natural materials can make playgrounds more fun for everyone. • Measure and compare spaces and materials to see what works best for safe and fair play.
• Follow the steps of the Engineering Design Process to solve a problem by imagining, planning, creating, testing, and improving their ideas.
• Measure and compare the length, width, and height of playground parts to make sure they fit and are safe for everyone. • Draw and sort their ideas using pictures, charts, and diagrams.
• Build with 2D and 3D shapes and use patterns and bright colors to help others play. • Use ramps, shapes, and colors to build fun and safe play areas.
• Try out different materials to see which ones are strong and safe. • Make simple circuits to light things up or make sounds.
• Use m.Block to help a character move through a fun maze.
